jdbconnection
Class JDBCConnection

java.lang.Object
  jdbconnection.JDBCConnection

public class JDBCConnection
extends java.lang.Object

This class gets a connection to our database for the caller. It is the caller's responsibility to close the connection when he is done.

Method Detail

closeConnection

public void closeConnection()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
This method closes the database connection. If an instance of JDBCConnection is created, this closeConnection() method MUST be called when the user is done with the connection. It is preferable for you to put this method in a finally block.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getJDBCConnection

public static java.sql.Connection getJDBCConnection()
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Returns a connection the database. It is the caller's responsibility to close this connection when he is finished. Synonym for getConnection()

Returns:
a connection to the database
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection to the database cannot be made
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the driver cannot be found

getConnection

public static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Returns a connection the database. It is the caller's responsibility to close this connection when he is finished. Synonym for getJDBCConnection()

Returns:
a connection to the database
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection to the database cannot be made
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the driver cannot be found

makeQuery

public static java.lang.String makeQuery(java.lang.String tableName,
                                         java.lang.String columnName,
                                         java.lang.String constraint)
This method generates a simple SQL query of the form SELECT ___ FROM ____ WHERE ____ Both tableName and columnName will be filtered for ' characters, but it is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that constraint does not contain any characters that will escape the SQL statement.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table you are querying
columnName - the name of the column that you are selecting the results from
constraint - the condition that narrows your results
Returns:
a string containing a valid SQL query
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if tableName is null

makeInsert

public static java.lang.String makeInsert(java.lang.String tableName,
                                          java.lang.String[][] information)
This method makes an insert query of the form INSERT INTO tableName (information[COLUMNS][0], information[COLUMNS][1], ..., information[COLUMNS][n]) VALUES (information[VALUES][0], information[VALUES][1], ..., information[VALUES][n])

Parameters:
tableName -
information -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any information is null

getResults

public java.sql.ResultSet getResults(java.lang.String query)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method gets the results of an SQL query that you provide

Parameters:
query - a SELECT FROM WHERE query
Returns:
the results of the query
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection to the database cannot be made
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the Driver cannot be found

getResults

public java.sql.ResultSet getResults(java.lang.String query,
                                     int numParameters,
                                     java.lang.String[] parameters)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method uses PreparedStatement to get a ResultSet. A query should be of form SELECT * FROM tableName WHERE condition = ? where there can be as many ? as you require, so long as the number of them is given. An array holding the Strings you want to replace the ? with should also be provided.

Parameters:
query - The SQL query with a number of parameters to be filled in
numParameters - the number of ?s to be filled in
parameters - an array of the strings to replace the ?s with
Returns:
the results of the sql query
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection to the database cannot be made
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

update

public int update(java.lang.String query)
           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method executes a query that changes the database. It can be either an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE query.

Parameters:
query -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

update

public int update(java.lang.String query,
                  int numParameters,
                  java.lang.String[] parameters)
           throws java.lang.Exception
This method executes a query that chagnse the database. It can be either an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE query. It uses PreparedStatement to prevent escaping SQL statements with '

Parameters:
query - the update query
numParameters - the number of ?s to fill in
parameters - what to fill the ?s in with
Returns:
the number of lines changed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

openConnection

public void openConnection()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
This method is used to re-open a database connection if you have closed it

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
